metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26373 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts insome Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
